intro: Agelaea trifolia, commonly known as the three-leaved agelaea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Agelaea trifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
